q: and she knows we love her." New York Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand was also there when it happened. She said once Gabrielle Giffords heard her husband's voice, she opened her eyes. All of a sudden she started to struggle to open her eyes. And so Mark saw that and said-- "Open your eyes Gabrielle Giffords , open your eyes.' She kept struggling and struggling and Mark kept encouraging her. And within a moment she literally opened her eyes. The doctor was unbelievably excited because this was such great progress, said Kirsten Gillibrand . New York"s junior senator got to know the Arizona representative during their time together in the House. Kirsten Gillibrand says she told Gabrielle Giffords that people are pulling for her and are inspired

NBA.com staff reports-- Allen Iverson 's season is over. The Detroit Red Pistons said Friday the All-Star guard will miss the rest of the season-- and the playoffs if they make it-- because of a sore back. After talking with Allen Iverson and our medical staff, we feel that resting Allen Iverson for the remainder of the season is the best course of action at this time, Pistons president of basketball operations Joe Dumars said in a statement released by the team. Mike Pence greet people in the Grand Hall in Union Station Tuesday, November 2, 2010 at the Indiana Republican Election Night Party. Mike Pence easily won reelection for his 6th Congressional District seat. He told the crowd, I believe history will record... Indiana led the country back. Charlie Nye/ The Star. Nine-year-old Austin Stout , Brownsburg, left, comes up to congratulate Indiana Congressman Mike Pence , who won reelection for his 6th District seat, with wife Karen Pence at his side, after his victory

minister of state for antiquities Zahi Hawass said on Sunday. The objects missing from the famed museum included "a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess" and parts of a gilded wood statue of Tutankhamun harpooning, Zahi Hawass said in a statement. 2011 Turin: Fiat SpA Chief Executive Officer Sergio Marchionne confirmed the Italian carmaker's pledge to spend â¬ 20 billion( Dh100.8 billion) revamping its domestic plants after meeting with Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi . Fiat is a multinational which is expanding internationally, but will keep an Italian heart, Industry Minister Paolo Romani said yesterday after discussing the investment plan with the CEO and Chairman John Elkann .
